Administration.text:
Type:
Antihypertensive
;
potassium sparing diuretic
; aldosterone receptor antagonist
Dosage Forms: 25,50,100
Routes of Administration: Oral
Common Trade Names: Aldactone

Edema.text:
25-200mg/day PO divided QD-bid
For edema associated with
CHF
,
cirrhosis
, or
nephrotic syndrome

Hypertension.text:
25-50mg/day PO divided QD-bid
Start: 12.5mg PO QD

CHF,_NYHA_Class_III/IV.text:
25mg PO QD
Use with standard treatment; may increase to 50mg/day after 8wk for worsening CHF if K stable
May decrease to 25mg qod if hyperkalemia; hold if K >5 mEq/L or creatinine >4mg/dL

Acne_vulgaris.text:
50-200mg PO QD
Start: 25mg PO QD
Off label use

Pharmacology.text:
Half-life: 1.3-2h (parent drug), 13.8-16.5h (active metabolites)
Metabolism: Liver
Excretion: Urine

Mechanism_of_Action.text: Antagonizes aldosterone receptors in the distal convoluted tubule, decreasing Na and water reabsorption and increasing K retention
